alert.note: Alert for Baker; Malheur (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 09 at 2:07PM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM MDT/515 PM PDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dry washes and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Southeast Baker County, northeast Malheur County. * WHEN...Until 615 PM MDT /515 PM PDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 304 PM MDT /204 PM PDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause dry washes and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Burnt River, Reiber Creek, Willow Creek, Mahogany Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Brogan, Huntington, Lime, Dixie, Weatherby. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
